title.narrative: Readiness Support for the Development of the Vanuatu National Green Energy Fund

description.narrative: Inform the strategy and implementation planning of National Green Energy Fund (NGEF) by identifying potential opportunities – both short term and long term. Support the design and operationalization NGEF

To contribute to the country’s energy access and sustainability targets the Government of Vanuatu approved the establishment of the National Green Energy Fund (NGEF) through a decision by the Council of Ministers in 2016. GCF Readiness Program will allow NGCF to finalize required feasibility studies with an aim to enable an informed decision by the government regarding the NGEF strategy and implementation priorities. Vanuatu has more than 60 inhabited islands and is extremely vulnerable to climate change but has only 9% electrification in off-grid areas (outside of urban concession areas). The country has a USD 20 million financing gap to achieve national energy access targets has been identified (National Energy Roadmap, 2016). At the same time under the sustainable energy objective, a target of 100% renewable energy in the electricity sector has been set for the year 2030 (Nationally Determined Contributions, 2015).

mailing-address.narrative: Global Green Growth Institute, 19F Jeongdong Bldg., 21-15 Jeongdong-gil, Jung-gu Seoul 04566 Republic of Korea

title.narrative: "GCF Readiness Program for Vanuatu" - Project Results Report
Market infrastructure and business model study.

description.narrative: A supply chain analysis for the deployment of off-grid solar network and business opportunities. ? A mapping of potential financing requirements ? debt and equity for the sector players across the value chain, with a view to accessing finance from the NGEF. ? An assessment of regulatory requirements and procedures for investments (potentially from NGEF). ? The development of a pipeline of more than 50 potential projects for the NGEF business plan.

title.narrative: A market infrastructure and business model study is completed and report finalized.

Contribute to the Vanuatu NERM Targets: 1. Accessible Energy Electricity in Off Grid Areas (60% of households in 2020 and 100% in 2030) 2. Sustainable Energy Renewable Electricity Generation ( 65% of electricity generated from renewable sources in 2020 and 100% in 2030)

description.narrative: The following activities were completed: ? A representative rural household surveys at selected individual islands to assess: ? Current and potential electricity demand and representative load curves with future projections to determine market size. ? Current and potential demand for energy efficiency. ? Ability and willingness to pay for sustainable energy services. ? A representative rural enterprises and cooperatives survey at selected individual islands to assess: ? Potential of types and characteristics of productive enterprise loads which can be met. ? Potential of each enterprise to expand and/or to reach local/ international markets through utilization of sustainable energy for production and/or provision of services. ? Ability and willingness to pay for energy services for productive use. ? A preliminary assessment of current (and applicable) payment systems. ? Presentation of the results of the market demand study to a stakeholder workshop on 15th May 2018

title.narrative: A market demand study including survey results is completed and report finalised.

description.narrative: The following activities were completed: ? A review of recent energy sector publications. ? A techno-economic landscape mapping, including: Comprehensive assessment of current technologies to meet energy sourcing mix requirements of households; Comprehensive assessment on current cost (upfront and operational) for current technologies to meet energy sourcing mix requirements of households. ? A technical feasibility for off-grid energy systems. ? A minimum performance criteria of standardized modular PV systems appropriate for Vanuatu’s weather and climate conditions. ? An assessment of potential metering solutions for energy services. ? A preliminary assessment of renewable energy and energy efficiency technology deployment keeping in mind future grid extension plans and development scenarios. ? Presentation of the results of the renewable energy and energy efficiency technology study to a stakeholder workshop on 15th May 2018.

title.narrative: A renewable energy and energy efficiency technology study is completed and report finalized.

description.narrative: The project completed three feasibility studies and conducted a workshop to present all the results on 15th May 2018. The project also completed an investor forum for the NGEF on 16th May 2018. All feasibility studies were presented to the NGEF Task Force, comments were integrated and the studies were approved. Furthermore, the studies resulted in the development of a pipeline of more than 50 projects, provided inputs into the Operational Manual for the NGEF and produced a business plan for the NGEF which were also presented to the NGEF Task Force.

title.narrative: NGEF Task Force approves three Feasibility Studies submitted by GGGI

description.narrative: The project management activities were completed with strong collaboration and support of the Government of Vanuatu and support from GGGI’s head office. The outcomes, outputs and activities in 2018 aligned to the CPF. All outcomes and outputs have been completed. Furthermore, as an indication of the good working relationship with the Government, GGGI was nominated by the NDA to be the Delivery Partner for three new GCF Readiness proposals.

title.narrative: Successful implementation of the readiness project to support the development of the NGEF
